title: 75/12. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization
text:
United Nations 
A/RES/75/12
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: General 
30 November 2020 
 
20-15849 (E)    071220 
*2015849* 
 
 
Seventy-fifth session 
Agenda item 130 (o) 
Cooperation between the United Nations and regional 
and other organizations: cooperation between the 
United Nations and the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 23 November 2020 
 
 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/75/L.22 and A/75/L.22/Add.1)] 
 
 
 
75/12. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea 
Economic Cooperation Organization 
 
 
 
The General Assembly,  
 
Recalling its resolution 54/5 of 8 October 1999, by which it granted observer 
status to the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization, as well as its previous 
resolutions on cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization, including resolution 73/13 of 26 November 2018,  
 
Reaffirming its pledge to international cooperation and multilateralism, as the 
United Nations commemorates its seventy-fifth anniversary,  
 
Recalling that one of the purposes of the United Nations is to achieve 
international cooperation in solving international problems of an economic, social or 
humanitarian nature,  
 
Recalling also the Articles of the Charter of the United Nations that encourage 
activities through regional cooperation for the promotion of the purposes and 
principles of the United Nations,  
 
Reaffirming its resolution 70/1 of 25 September 2015, entitled “Transforming 
our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”, and its resolution 69/313 
of 27 July 2015 on the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International 
Conference on Financing for Development,  
 
Recalling its Declaration on the Enhancement of Cooperation between the 
United Nations and Regional Arrangements or Agencies in the Maintenance of 
International Peace and Security of 9 December 1994, 1  
__________________ 
 
1  Resolution 49/57, annex. 

A/RES/75/12 
Cooperation between the United Nations and the 
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization
 
20-15849
2/6 
 
 
Recognizing that any dispute or conflict in the region impedes cooperation, and 
stressing the need to solve such a dispute or conflict on the basis of the norms and 
principles of international law,  
 
Recalling that, in the Charter of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization, the States members of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization 
expressed the desire of their countries and peoples for constructive and fruitful 
collaboration in wide-ranging fields of economic activity with the aim of turning the 
Black Sea economic cooperation region into one of peace, stability and prosperity,  
 
Reaffirming that the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic requires a 
global response based on unity, solidarity and renewed multilateral cooperation,  
 
Convinced that the strengthening of cooperation between the United Nations 
and other organizations contributes to the promotion of the purposes and principles 
of the United Nations,  
 
Taking note of the report of the Secretary-General submitted pursuant to 
resolution 73/13,2  
 
1. 
Recalls the Declaration adopted by the Heads of State and Government of 
the States members of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization on the 
occasion of the Twenty-Fifth Anniversary Summit of the Organization, held in 
Istanbul, Turkey, on 22 May 2017;  
 
2. 
Reiterates the conviction that multilateral economic cooperation contributes 
to enhancing peace, stability and security to the benefit of the wider Black Sea area; 
 
3. 
Welcomes the ongoing commitment of the States members of the Black 
Sea Economic Cooperation Organization to the implementation of the Black Sea 
Economic Cooperation Agenda, “Towards an enhanced Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Partnership”, endorsed by the Heads of State and Government of the 
States members of the Organization at its Twentieth Anniversary Summit, held in 
Istanbul, in which the member States had reiterated their commitment to enhancing 
the economic mission and the project-oriented dimension of the Organization;  
 
4. 
Takes note of the initiatives of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization aimed at mitigating the adverse effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for 
the member States, as well as of its activities for strengthening regional cooperation 
in such fields as energy, including renewable energy and energy efficiency, transport, 
institutional renewal and good governance, trade and economic development, 
banking and finance, emergency assistance, environmental protection, sustainable 
development of the small and medium-sized enterprises sector and entrepreneurship, 
communications, including the information and communications technology sector 
and digitalization, culture, education, tourism, science and technology, exchange of 
statistical data and economic information, collaboration among customs authorities 
and combating organized crime and trafficking in drugs, weapons and radioactive 
material, acts of terrorism and illegal migration and in other related spheres;  
 
5. 
Welcomes the efforts of the States members of the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization aimed at increasing its efficiency and effectiveness;  
 
6. 
Underlines the importance of taking further coordinated and active steps 
for the implementation of the joint regional projects in the field of transport under the 
Memorandum of Understanding for the Coordinated Development of the Black Sea 
Ring Highway and the Memorandum of Understanding on the Development of 
__________________ 
 
2  See A/75/345-S/2020/898, sect. II. 

Cooperation between the United Nations and the  
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization 
A/RES/75/12
 
3/6
20-15849 
 
Motorways of the Sea at the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization Region, 
which will contribute to the further development of Euro-Asian transport links;  
 
7. 
Greets the ongoing efforts of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization under the Memorandum of Understanding on Facilitation of Road 
Transport of Goods in the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization Region, 
aimed at facilitating international road transport of goods on the basis of removing 
barriers hampering mutually beneficial participation of road transport operators in 
bilateral and transit transportation;  
 
8. 
Welcomes the efforts carried out by the States members of the Black Sea 
Economic Cooperation Organization for the implementation of the Green Energy 
Strategy, which affords States members of the Organization new opportunities with 
regard to the elaboration and adoption of their green energy policies and the 
strengthening of regional cooperation in the field of green energy, endorsed at the 
thirty-eighth meeting of the Council of Ministers of Foreign Affairs of the Black Sea 
Economic Cooperation Organization, held in Yerevan on 27 June 2018; 
 
9. 
Greets also the recently established practice of holding annually by the 
Institute for Energy and Finance of the Russian Federation, with the support of the 
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization, the International conference entitled 
“Risk Management in Energy”, aimed at mitigating various risk factors in the field of 
energy and ensuring stable and predictable functioning of energy markets, and the 
outcomes of its third meeting held in Istanbul on 28 March 2020 via videoconference 
mode;  
 
10. Welcomes the “75 UN – 75 trees UNAI SDG 7” initiative, marking the 
seventy-fifth anniversary of the United Nations, proposed by the Energy Policy and 
Development Centre of the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens as the 
United Nations Academic Impact Hub for Sustainable Development Goal 7 and as the 
Coordinator of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization Green Energy 
Network in order to contribute to the fight against the negative effects of climate 
change;  
 
11. 
Notes the activities undertaken by the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization Green Energy Network with regard to exchanging information, sharing 
experiences and good practices, elaborating and implementing regional energy 
efficiency projects and promoting investments in green energy in the Black Sea 
region;  
 
12. Also notes the activities aimed at developing effective policies and 
concrete measures to support the sustainable development of small and medium-sized 
enterprises in the Black Sea region and to help them to improve their performance 
through, inter alia, the assistance of the Black Sea Trade and Development Bank;  
 
13. Calls for greater cooperation between the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization and international financial institutions in co-financing 
feasibility and pre-feasibility studies for projects in all countries of the wider Black 
Sea area;  
 
14. Takes note of the consultations between the World Bank and the Permanent 
International Secretariat of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization 
concerning the implementation of the “Blueing the Black Sea Programme (BBSEA)” 
and expects it to catalyse investments in the blue economy sector in the Black Sea 
region with due regard and alignment with their national priorities and strategies;  
 
15. Acknowledges the interest of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization in contributing to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for 

A/RES/75/12 
Cooperation between the United Nations and the 
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization
 
20-15849
4/6 
 
Sustainable Development,3 bearing in mind the importance of the regional and 
subregional dimensions, regional economic integration and interconnectivity in 
sustainable development and that regional and subregional frameworks can facilitate 
the effective translation of sustainable development policies into concrete action at 
the national level;  
 
16. Calls upon the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization to support 
the efforts aimed at promoting robust economies and enhanced land and maritime 
connectivity solutions as an essential prerequisite for overcoming the COVID-19 
pandemic, providing for economic recovery and growth, and getting back on track 
towards advancing sustainable development;  
 
17. Notes the ongoing contributions of the related bodies of the Black Sea 
Economic Cooperation Organization, namely, the Parliamentary Assembly of the Black 
Sea Economic Cooperation, the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Business Council, 
the Black Sea Trade and Development Bank and the International Centre for the Black 
Sea Studies, to the strengthening of multifaceted regional cooperation in the region;  
 
18. Welcomes the ongoing commitment of the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization to promoting and implementing fruitful cooperation with 
the funds, programmes and specialized agencies of the United Nations system, in 
particular to developing practical and goal-oriented projects, in areas of common 
interests, as reiterated in the Black Sea Economic Agenda, “Toward an Enhanced 
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Partnership”, endorsed at the Twentieth 
Anniversary Summit of the Organization;  
 
19. Also welcomes the ongoing cooperation between the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Development Programme, the 
Economic Commission for Europe, the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, 
the International Organization for Migration, the United Nations Environment 
Programme, the United Nations Industrial Development Organization, the World 
Health Organization, the World Tourism Organization, the Food and Agriculture 
Organization of the United Nations and the United Nations Educational, Scientific 
and Cultural Organization;  
 
20. Further welcomes the efforts of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization in strengthening the project-oriented dimension of the Organization, in 
particular by further reinvigorating the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Project 
Development Fund;  
 
21. Takes note of the ongoing activities and practical outcomes of the Black 
Sea Project Promotion Facility in support of regional projects in the fields of 
renewable energy, energy efficiency, green technologies, the development of small 
and medium-sized enterprises, the advancement of the knowledge economy, capacity-
building and the promotion of the export potential of the States members of the Black 
Sea Economic Cooperation Organization;  
 
22. Underlines the advancement of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization/Black Sea Trade and Development Bank-related project implementation 
and technical cooperation activities in the fields of energy, transport, public utilities, 
manufacturing, municipal services, environmental protection, small and medium-
sized enterprises, telecommunications and the financial sector;  
 
23. Notes the willingness of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization to continue to implement sustainable development strategies based on a 
balanced and harmonious relationship between social needs and economic activities 
and to encourage measures to rehabilitate, protect and preserve the environment in 
__________________ 
 
3  Resolution 70/1. 

Cooperation between the United Nations and the  
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization 
A/RES/75/12
 
5/6
20-15849 
 
the Black Sea region, and in this regard welcomes its cooperation with the United 
Nations Environment Programme and the Commission on the Protection of the Black 
Sea against Pollution;  
 
24. Also notes the ongoing cooperation between the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, and 
within this framework welcomes the positive results of the ongoing projects to 
strengthen the criminal justice response to trafficking in persons in the Black Sea 
region;  
 
25. Welcomes the ongoing multifaceted and fruitful cooperation between the 
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the Economic Commission for 
Europe, especially in the area of transport, within the framework of the Cooperation 
Agreement signed by the two organizations;  
 
26. Encourages the full implementation of the Cooperation Agreement 
between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the United Nations 
Environment Programme of 20 February 2002 and the Relationship Agreement 
between the Organization and the United Nations Industrial Development Organization;  
 
27. Also encourages deeper cooperation between the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization and the World Health Organization and the World Tourism 
Organization in order to respond to, overcome and recover from the COVID-19 
pandemic and build preparedness for future similar crises, while facilitating the safe 
movement of people and supporting the tourist industry, jobs, and small and medium-
sized enterprises, without compromising health conditions;  
 
28. Notes that the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization is a member 
of the Group of Friends of the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations, and welcomes 
the commitment to broaden cooperation in the accomplishment of the mission of the 
Alliance, as established by the Secretary-General, and in the promotion of 
understanding and reconciliation among cultures, globally and regionally, as set out 
in the Memorandum of Understanding between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation 
Organization and the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations, which was approved 
in Bucharest and signed in Baku;  
 
29. Welcomes the enhanced cooperation between the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization and the European Union in the Black Sea region alongside 
mutually agreed priorities and fields of cooperation, through a joint action and 
bottom-up, project-oriented approach, in a balanced and mutually beneficial way; 
 
30. Takes note of the cooperation established between the Black Sea Economic 
Cooperation Organization and other regional organizations and initiatives, and in this 
regard encourages the further development of cooperation with the regional 
organizations and integration unions concerned, in particular those in Eastern Europe 
and Central Asia;  
 
31. Invites the Secretary-General to strengthen dialogue with the Black Sea 
Economic Cooperation Organization with a view to promoting cooperation and 
coordination between the secretariats of the two organizations;  
 
32. Invites the funds, programmes and specialized agencies of the United 
Nations system to cooperate with the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization 
in order to continue joint projects and programmes with the Organization and its 
related bodies for the achievement of their objectives;  
 
33. Requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly at its 
seventy-seventh session a report on the implementation of the present resolution;  

A/RES/75/12 
Cooperation between the United Nations and the 
Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization
 
20-15849
6/6 
 
 
34. Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its seventy-seventh 
session, under the item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and 
regional and other organizations”, the sub-item entitled “Cooperation between the 
United Nations and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization”. 
 
30th plenary meeting 
23 November 2020

paragraphs.1: Recalls the Declaration adopted by the Heads of State and Government of the States members of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization on the occasion of the Twenty-Fifth Anniversary Summit of the Organization, held in Istanbul, Turkey, on 22 May 2017;
paragraphs.2: Reiterates the conviction that multilateral economic cooperation contributes to enhancing peace, stability and security to the benefit of the wider Black Sea area;
paragraphs.3: Welcomes the ongoing commitment of the States members of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization to the implementation of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Agenda, “Towards an enhanced Black Sea Economic Cooperation Partnership”, endorsed by the Heads of State and Government of the States members of the Organization at its Twentieth Anniversary Summit, held in Istanbul, in which the member States had reiterated their commitment to enhancing the economic mission and the project-oriented dimension of the Organization;
paragraphs.4: Takes note of the initiatives of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization aimed at mitigating the adverse effects of the COVID-19 pandemic for the member States, as well as of its activities for strengthening regional cooperation in such fields as energy, including renewable energy and energy efficiency, transport, institutional renewal and good governance, trade and economic development, banking and finance, emergency assistance, environmental protection, sustainable development of the small and medium-sized enterprises sector and entrepreneurship, communications, including the information and communications technology sector and digitalization, culture, education, tourism, science and technology, exchange of statistical data and economic information, collaboration among customs authorities and combating organized crime and trafficking in drugs, weapons and radioactive material, acts of terrorism and illegal migration and in other related spheres;
paragraphs.5: Welcomes the efforts of the States members of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization aimed at increasing its efficiency and effectiveness;
paragraphs.6: Underlines the importance of taking further coordinated and active steps for the implementation of the joint regional projects in the field of transport under the Memorandum of Understanding for the Coordinated Development of the Black Sea Ring Highway and the Memorandum of Understanding on the Development of __________________ 2 See A/75/345-S/2020/898, sect. II. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization A/RES/75/12 3/6 20-15849 Motorways of the Sea at the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization Region, which will contribute to the further development of Euro-Asian transport links;
paragraphs.7: Greets the ongoing efforts of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization under the Memorandum of Understanding on Facilitation of Road Transport of Goods in the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization Region, aimed at facilitating international road transport of goods on the basis of removing barriers hampering mutually beneficial participation of road transport operators in bilateral and transit transportation;
paragraphs.8: Welcomes the efforts carried out by the States members of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization for the implementation of the Green Energy Strategy, which affords States members of the Organization new opportunities with regard to the elaboration and adoption of their green energy policies and the strengthening of regional cooperation in the field of green energy, endorsed at the thirty-eighth meeting of the Council of Ministers of Foreign Affairs of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization, held in Yerevan on 27 June 2018;
paragraphs.9: Greets also the recently established practice of holding annually by the Institute for Energy and Finance of the Russian Federation, with the support of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization, the International conference entitled “Risk Management in Energy”, aimed at mitigating various risk factors in the field of energy and ensuring stable and predictable functioning of energy markets, and the outcomes of its third meeting held in Istanbul on 28 March 2020 via videoconference mode;
paragraphs.10: Welcomes the “75 UN – 75 trees UNAI SDG 7” initiative, marking the seventy-fifth anniversary of the United Nations, proposed by the Energy Policy and Development Centre of the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens as the United Nations Academic Impact Hub for Sustainable Development Goal 7 and as the Coordinator of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization Green Energy Network in order to contribute to the fight against the negative effects of climate change;
paragraphs.11: Notes the activities undertaken by the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization Green Energy Network with regard to exchanging information, sharing experiences and good practices, elaborating and implementing regional energy efficiency projects and promoting investments in green energy in the Black Sea region;
paragraphs.12: Also notes the activities aimed at developing effective policies and concrete measures to support the sustainable development of small and medium-sized enterprises in the Black Sea region and to help them to improve their performance through, inter alia, the assistance of the Black Sea Trade and Development Bank;
paragraphs.13: Calls for greater cooperation between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and international financial institutions in co-financing feasibility and pre-feasibility studies for projects in all countries of the wider Black Sea area;
paragraphs.14: Takes note of the consultations between the World Bank and the Permanent International Secretariat of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization concerning the implementation of the “Blueing the Black Sea Programme (BBSEA)” and expects it to catalyse investments in the blue economy sector in the Black Sea region with due regard and alignment with their national priorities and strategies;
paragraphs.15: Acknowledges the interest of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization in contributing to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for A/RES/75/12 Cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization 20-15849 4/6 Sustainable Development,3 bearing in mind the importance of the regional and subregional dimensions, regional economic integration and interconnectivity in sustainable development and that regional and subregional frameworks can facilitate the effective translation of sustainable development policies into concrete action at the national level;
paragraphs.16: Calls upon the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization to support the efforts aimed at promoting robust economies and enhanced land and maritime connectivity solutions as an essential prerequisite for overcoming the COVID-19 pandemic, providing for economic recovery and growth, and getting back on track towards advancing sustainable development;
paragraphs.17: Notes the ongoing contributions of the related bodies of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization, namely, the Parliamentary Assembly of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation, the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Business Council, the Black Sea Trade and Development Bank and the International Centre for the Black Sea Studies, to the strengthening of multifaceted regional cooperation in the region;
paragraphs.18: Welcomes the ongoing commitment of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization to promoting and implementing fruitful cooperation with the funds, programmes and specialized agencies of the United Nations system, in particular to developing practical and goal-oriented projects, in areas of common interests, as reiterated in the Black Sea Economic Agenda, “Toward an Enhanced Black Sea Economic Cooperation Partnership”, endorsed at the Twentieth Anniversary Summit of the Organization;
paragraphs.19: Also welcomes the ongoing cooperation between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Development Programme, the Economic Commission for Europe, the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, the International Organization for Migration, the United Nations Environment Programme, the United Nations Industrial Development Organization, the World Health Organization, the World Tourism Organization, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization;
paragraphs.20: Further welcomes the efforts of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization in strengthening the project-oriented dimension of the Organization, in particular by further reinvigorating the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Project Development Fund;
paragraphs.21: Takes note of the ongoing activities and practical outcomes of the Black Sea Project Promotion Facility in support of regional projects in the fields of renewable energy, energy efficiency, green technologies, the development of small and medium-sized enterprises, the advancement of the knowledge economy, capacity- building and the promotion of the export potential of the States members of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization;
paragraphs.22: Underlines the advancement of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization/Black Sea Trade and Development Bank-related project implementation and technical cooperation activities in the fields of energy, transport, public utilities, manufacturing, municipal services, environmental protection, small and medium- sized enterprises, telecommunications and the financial sector;
paragraphs.23: Notes the willingness of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization to continue to implement sustainable development strategies based on a balanced and harmonious relationship between social needs and economic activities and to encourage measures to rehabilitate, protect and preserve the environment in __________________ 3 Resolution 70/1. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization A/RES/75/12 5/6 20-15849 the Black Sea region, and in this regard welcomes its cooperation with the United Nations Environment Programme and the Commission on the Protection of the Black Sea against Pollution;
paragraphs.24: Also notes the ongoing cooperation between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, and within this framework welcomes the positive results of the ongoing projects to strengthen the criminal justice response to trafficking in persons in the Black Sea region;
paragraphs.25: Welcomes the ongoing multifaceted and fruitful cooperation between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the Economic Commission for Europe, especially in the area of transport, within the framework of the Cooperation Agreement signed by the two organizations;
paragraphs.26: Encourages the full implementation of the Cooperation Agreement between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Environment Programme of 20 February 2002 and the Relationship Agreement between the Organization and the United Nations Industrial Development Organization;
paragraphs.27: Also encourages deeper cooperation between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the World Health Organization and the World Tourism Organization in order to respond to, overcome and recover from the COVID-19 pandemic and build preparedness for future similar crises, while facilitating the safe movement of people and supporting the tourist industry, jobs, and small and medium- sized enterprises, without compromising health conditions;
paragraphs.28: Notes that the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization is a member of the Group of Friends of the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations, and welcomes the commitment to broaden cooperation in the accomplishment of the mission of the Alliance, as established by the Secretary-General, and in the promotion of understanding and reconciliation among cultures, globally and regionally, as set out in the Memorandum of Understanding between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations, which was approved in Bucharest and signed in Baku;
paragraphs.29: Welcomes the enhanced cooperation between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and the European Union in the Black Sea region alongside mutually agreed priorities and fields of cooperation, through a joint action and bottom-up, project-oriented approach, in a balanced and mutually beneficial way;
paragraphs.30: Takes note of the cooperation established between the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization and other regional organizations and initiatives, and in this regard encourages the further development of cooperation with the regional organizations and integration unions concerned, in particular those in Eastern Europe and Central Asia;
paragraphs.31: Invites the Secretary-General to strengthen dialogue with the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization with a view to promoting cooperation and coordination between the secretariats of the two organizations;
paragraphs.32: Invites the funds, programmes and specialized agencies of the United Nations system to cooperate with the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization in order to continue joint projects and programmes with the Organization and its related bodies for the achievement of their objectives;
paragraphs.33: Requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly at its seventy-seventh session a report on the implementation of the present resolution; A/RES/75/12 Cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization 20-15849 6/6
paragraphs.34: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its seventy-seventh session, under the item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and regional and other organizations”, the sub-item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization”. 30th plenary meeting 23 November 2020
